Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Kerry M
Reviews.Content: We were overnighting in Sydney before traveling onto our next destination and after reading the reviews decided that we would give the Park8 a try. One very big mistake for the night rate we paid it was overpriced and overrated having stayed in other Hotels through out the world, they gave us a dark and dingy room on the 5th floor no natural light, small rom and the room was not clean. The only thing going for this hotel that the reception staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian E
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for the first time was Aug 2010 for 6 nights and we quickly realised we had found a gem of a Hotel. So much so that when we returned to Sydney in Jan 2012 we rebooked even though we found cheaper hotels available. The location is great for exploring Sydney close to several train stations and walking distance from circular quay and Sydneyâ€™s nightlife. The hotel its self is a gem from the past the foyer is from its Victorian past and as you walk into the hotel you enter a world of peace and tranquillity! The staff are very helpful and friendly and check in was faultless and quick. The rooms are small but they do have everything you require from a hotel room the rooms are very clean and serviced every day. There is building work on one side of the hotel, so if you want a quiet lay in ask the staff for a room on the other side of the hotel although this side is darker. We love this hotel and l we are looking forward to our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price. Small rooms. A bit quirky.”
Reviews.Author: KanataMike
Reviews.Content: Sydney is an expensive and difficult city for hotel rooms. If you are searching on-line for a room, rates can double or triple overnight. The Castlereagh is in a good location and comes at a fair price for downtown Sydney. It is close to the busses, trains and shopping and eating areas. It's clean and the rooms are well maintained. The staff are helpful and the carpets and furnishings are generally good quality. The hotel is located in the HQ building of the New South Wales Freemasons. I am guessing that the hotel rooms were originally occupied by members staying overnight because they are very small and there is no storage space. The rooms are large enough for a single occupant but if you have a spouse, partner or anyone else camping in your room, itâ€™s a bit cramped. The window came with frosted glass - probably just as well since it overlooked a brick wall and a building site. A kettle was provided along with tea and coffee supplies but no power point for the kettle. (You can plug it into one of the bathroom sockets or one of the sockets on the floor). Wifi is available in every room but make sure that this is included in your room rate otherwise you will be charged $10 a day. If you can live with the small room, lack of storage space and lack of a view, this is a good place to stay because of its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twosisters4
Reviews.Content: it was a good motel they have got new carpet in the halls and in the rooms new shower head

Reviews.Title: “Great value, superb downtown location, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RegionalRoadie
Reviews.Content: I was initially attracted to the hotel because its price was so competitive compared to so many others hotels in the central business district (CBD). After I booked I was a tad skeptical because with a price that was anywhere from 1/3 to 1/2 of other hotels in the vicinity, the deal seemed too good to be true. In fact I really enjoyed my 5 night stay at the Castlereaugh. Without a doubt, I would stay there again. The location, friendly staff, and slightly above basic room features made this a hotel a great deal. My check-in was very quick and I have to thank Louis at the front desk for his incredibly quick, attentive, and professional service. He was always very quick and to provide me with my key on the many comings and going from the hotel. Room 609 was very spacious and had two twin beds. I was a single traveler so there was plenty of space to spare. DOn't expect a view though. The glass is smoked so you can't see out but some light is let in. On my last night I stayed in room 807 (a single and rather tight) because I added the last night on at the last minute. However, the absence of a view isn't really a big deal because there is nothing to see outside except other buildings and a skyscraper that is going up next to the Castlereaugh. There is a noise issue with this hotel though because a skyscraper is being constructed literally right next to the hotel. I always sleep with earplugs in and this would be a good idea here. In my grading, I'm not faulting the hotel because it's really out of their control. However, it is an unavoidable nuisance. The noises started around 7am and ceased around 6pm. At times the noise level was quite elevated. My two rooms were nicely but basically furnished. Both had a small desk, a smallish closet, and a minibar fridge. The wifi had it moments of strength but more often than not the signal was a bit on the weak side. The bathrooms in both rooms were probably the best feature. Not that they were spacious mind you, but there was lots of water pressure in the shower and I loved the wide shower head (they look like a sunflower or the type Holiday Inn Express uses in the USA). The tiling in the showers was very classy too. In fact the oddest feature of the entire room was having to step up into the bathroom. I found myself tripping over the ledge many a time. The bedding was okay but not dazzling. Don't expect Westin bedding at this price. The mattress was on the firm side. I've slept in a lot worse beds and there are extra comforters tucked in the closet. Not once did I need the air conditioning though I did test it to see if it works; and it did. Location is really what this hotel is about. The value of being about a 10 min walk to Darling Harbour, two blocks from either Town Hall or St James Cityrail stops, and half a block from a bus stop is immense. The easiest and fastest way to Circular Quay was walking to St James station and then taking the train to the next stop which is Circular Quay. There are numerous buses that depart Circular Quay and head down Castlreaugh St, so it's never more than few minutes for a bus. There are restaurants everywhere and plenty of snack shops too. You'll never have to walk more than a half a block to find something to eat. I made frequent stops at the Woolworth store that is attached to the Town Hall Station. I stocked up on fresh fruit, veggies, and inexpensive priced snacks for my munching between meals. Queen Victoria Building and all of the associated shopping is also two blocks away. Lastly, the staff were exceptionally friendly. Sophe and Louis at the front desk were real stand outs. It was a nice to be recognized by them after all the comings and goings (you leave your key at the front desk when leaving the property). The Castereagh is not what I would truly label a boutique hotel. There is much character in this building especially in the lobby. This is an endearing part of the hotel, but the hotel doesn't make any claim to be trendy or even fashionable. The rooms are clean, functional, and as one would expect for the price, they were on the comfortable side of basic. I give this hotel 4 stars because the staff were so kind and warm and the location is so central. But this is not a 4 star in the normal sense as I would expect a Hilton, Marriott, or Sheraton to be. You will go without the extras like a fitness center, a pool, a doorman, and a concierge. Guests that spend long days out of the room exploring the city or doing business then return looking for a relaxing place to rest that is both economical and yet comforting should find the Castereaugh a pleasant place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nickandsarah88
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, and i think they should advertise it more as it only a 10 minute walk to Darling harbour, 20 minutes to Circular Quay, and take a right out of the hotel and within 10 minutes or so there is a great selection of restaurants and bars. You can walk everywhere and it is really close to Museum station and James Station. When we walked in we thought the hotel looked very posh, and the reception area was very nice, but the room didn't seem to equate to the 4star rating. Although it was very comfortable and clean, it was dated and very small. We didn't want a massive room as we spent most of our time exploring the city and only use the room to sleep in, but it would've been nice to have a little extra floor space. The staff were great, very friendly and helpful. The shuttle bus they arranged for us was very convenient and cheaper than public transport, so i would recommend that. They even recommended blue mountain tours and vantage points for the fireworks prior to our stay, and whilst we were there, did everything they could to ensure we had a comfortable and enjoyable stay, whilst seeing everything we wanted to. The hotel was very quiet, even though it was over the new years period and the staff were great, and whilst the location was ideal and was just what we wanted, the room could've been slightly bigger. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price”
Reviews.Author: mindyhobart
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the location and price. Step out the door and you're right in the middle of Sydney shops DJs 5 minutes walk away. The rooms are small and the blanket on the bed looked old. We asked for an upgrade to a queen bed but the bed looked like a double. The bathroom was modern and the shower excellent but it was too small for comfort. Overall the hotel is adequate for the price and it's a great location.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money in city centre”
Reviews.Author: intrepiddu0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for the money in the city centre. We just loved the old fashioned charm of the place. Room was small but adequate, could have done with a chest of drawers as we had no drawer space, otherwise, no complaints at all. Staff were nice and friendly and food was very good in the restaurant. Everywhere was very clean, glass sparkling, brass poilished and thick deep carpets all over.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: smartywishbone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value in the heart of Sydney. There are a few problems with the place - mainly due to things wearing out. While we were there the aircon stopped but they offered us another room. We didn't bother cause it was not too hot but otherwise this could have been a problem. The people on the desk were great and really friendly. The rooms are small!! so don't expect anything grand but for the price and the location it was worth putting up with, particularly since you wouldn't be hanging out in your room all day anyway. It was a hotel where you can still open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “What a hovel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clraedc
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favour and stay ANYWHERE except here. (Park bench could be more comfortable!!) The rooms are FILTHY and small, I was prepared to make do here and used tissues to pick the long black hairs off the bedding and out of the shower recess, I also tried to ignore the stained bedding, however, the airconditioning didnt work and worst of all the staff do not care. Having spent the night in a 28 degree room, I checked out early and found the staff most uncaring as to my coming or going. The breakfast was dreadful. The amount I was to pay for an eveing in this establishment was $180. I paid $199 in alternate city hotel which was 5 star, clean, spacious and had wonderful staff. Do yourself a favour and research alternatives before staying in this hole.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueturtleADL
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but try getting a taxi driver to know where it is. Not really a boutique hotel in the sense of style or theme you would expect. Unless the building's primary purpose as headquarters to the Masonic Society is a theme. It's really more of a budget hotel. Service was efficient but without any friendliness. Yes the lobby, dining and function rooms are grand. But guest rooms are small and basic and not well maintained. But OK for what you pay for. If you stay there, check out the carefully stencilled instructions on the fire exit doors. It's a punctuation nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneBetty
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its central location and value for money. You can easily walk to the Rocks/Opera House area as well as go in the other direction to Darling Harbour/Chinatown.The rooms have everthing you need,nothing too fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay... eventually!”
Reviews.Author: Smallthing
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I flew in from Hong Kong so were tired upon arrival, but had a week stay to catch up on sleep. Unfortunately, the first room had that didn't close and a busy building site next door, so had to take an elevator ride to reception. Given a new room which we slept in for a couple of hours through sheer exhaustion. However, upon waking and examining the tiny room more closely, it transpired that the electrical sockets in the room didn't work (so our phones hadn't been charged) and the clothes dryer in the room was also broken, which was going to be a problem given the length of our stay, as was the fact that this new room had the noisy laundry room as it's neighbour. Additionally, it was only at this stage that we discovered that the in room safes that are advertised are only availvale at an additional daily rate, which I have never heard of before. Went down to reception thoroughly unimpressed where we met Louis: without question the best member of staff, who sorted all of our worries by rearranging rooms etc. Nice that it was all sorted and in the end we had a wonderful stay, but the rooms are small, the decor is dated and the building site next door is a nightmare (not that this is the hotel's fault, but the windows aren't double glazed and it does affect the stay). On the plus side, it is right in the heart of Sydney and convenient for all local attractions and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Jesslikesholidays
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the middle of things. Room was small but beautifully furnished, the common areas were quite lovely and grand and service was great. The hotel is looking a little tired but very clean and has a lot of character. For the price it is great. We definitely liked having access to the guest laundry with ironing board, washing machine and dryer. Only downside was the louvered door separating the bathroom from the bedroom left little to the imagination and the bed was smaller than average. We didnt try the restaurant at all so can't comment on the food. We would definitely cnosider staying here again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Cbd”
Reviews.Author: grandad57
Reviews.Content: Having read all the bad trip advisor reviews I decided to book anyway and I am so glad I did. Yes the rooms are small yes there is some noise but to be honest we were never in our room. Best thing about the hotel was the price considoring it's location and the customer service was great. Special mention to Louis for his warm welcome and recomendations. Next time I'm in Sydney I will reserve again for sure .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Accommodation w. Character”
Reviews.Author: traci_rae
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Executive Suite in Nov 2011. Loved it. The room was huge and had opening windows which was a nice surprise as I wasn't expecting it. The thing that stood out for me was the housekeeping. The room was immaculate and even coming back to a daily serviced room was like checking in all over again. The bed was brilliant and an abundance of pillows guarantees you to find one that suits. Location is excellent. Stones throw from Hyde Park, David Jones, Westfield and the Galleries on Pitt St. Check in and out was easy and prior to arriving email communication was prompt and informative. Staff were professional and courteous. I don't like over fussy service, but prefer simple yet quick and professional. I got it and couldn't be happier.I saw mixed reviews on this site about the hotel, so decided to upgrade. Very happy I did and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: James42_10
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, comfortable basic old-style hotel without many frills. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are small, but if you want larger, pay more elsewhere. Probably most suitable for single travelers on a budget. Service was good and friendly. Two bars - both OK. Location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Long in the Tooth - Really Long”
Reviews.Author: JAMES O
Reviews.Content: This could be such a nice little hotel, but seems to be so poorly operated that is unlikely it will ever be. I know that a modestly priced hotel in a desirable are is not going to be a perfect property and adjust expectations accordingly. The Castlereagh has a wonderful lobby and the first impression made there is very positive. That impression ends at the door to your room. They've put cheap discount store door knobs on many entries which look silly and function poorly. Light fixtures in the bathroom also appear to have come from a home improvement store. There is a cup hook screwed into the plaster, apparently for the room key. On a positive note, the shower worked very well with a good spray and nice, hot water. The television in our room is shimmed up on a couple of wooden blocks, presumably to keep it from falling off the fiber board shelf that is so obviously overtaxed with the burden of the ancient set. The bed was comfortable, with sheets and pillowcases in good shape. The windows were filthy and the valance dark with age. The staff representatives we encountered were efficient and helpful at every opportunity to be of service. The management seems determined to nickle and dime their guests, apparently seeing amenities as profit centers rather than considering them features that attract and retain guests. I knew the internet would be ten dollars a day - no complaint. But after authorizing the payment, I learned that the fee was PER computer. I could not connect my Android phone without forking over another $10. Nor, could I update our Kindles without ponying up yet again (twice). There was a safe in the closet, but no key. The charge for using the safe wasn't just $4.00 â€“ but $4.00 per day. I'm surprised the elevators aren't coin operated. This hotel did nothing to complement our visit to Sydney and I could not recommend it. To me, that's a shame. The location is great, the people working there are first rate, the building has a history and the rooms have good bones. But the place is being cheaply maintained â€“ and shows it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy, very smart inside but no parking!!”
Reviews.Author: Kanesmum
Reviews.Content: Nightmare to unpack the car in heavy traffic!!! The hotel is a doors width of an entrance amidst the shops on the busy Castlereagh Street. Very convenient location for all amenities. Decor is pleasing even though it looks dated - it has the glamourous touch to it. Double room are small but clean and comfy. Windows mostly hidden with attractive blinds and extra lighting, as they are old metal windows looking at another building. We were room 1002 on the 10th floor. There are 3 lifts and the restraunt for breakfast is on the 4th floor. Only stayed once for brekky as the QVB nearby (Queen Victoria Building) offered a variety of meals and snacks for a cheaper price. Hotel recommended - if you can afford $50 every time you park the car somewhere!!! photos to follow hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, an uncomfortable stay for us.”
Reviews.Author: nyaan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one year ago as we had a conference. We did not book the hotel as it was more like booked for us by someone else. We were told, we'd be very delighted by the place. Unfortunately, when we arrived into our room, we were a bit underwhelmed. The room was tiny, the bathroom was tiny and narrow. To make myself feel less claustrophobic, we actually left the wardrobe door opened. The staff when we checked in and out was lovely. The lady, when we checked in was very helpful with maps and directions etc. Unfortunately, when we need to print our boarding pass to return home, we asked the gentleman at the front desk if he can help us with this. We were told to go to Safeway. Not helpful at all, as we knew that Safeway doesn't do printing. Even a polite "no" would have sufficed, or we would have paid any charges required. But to be given the wrong information curtly was a bit disappointing. Unfortunately, the overall experience was so negative that it left us with very deep impression that even after 1 year, we still remember how awful it was. Maybe this place would suit some people who are after a place with character, just to sleep at night without any other consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Going Back”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: This hotel packs in a lot of charm into a small package. Yes, the room is small, but what do you expect from a "boutique" hotel? When I was there, I had room service every morning. The room was made up by the time I got back in the afternoon. The bed was comfortable, the ac was self-controlled, and I had my own bathroom. For the price I paid, I couldn't have asked for anything better. I was centrally located, the nearest station was a few minutes walking. The hotel staff was exemplary. Being a foreign traveller, I bought some items that would have spoiled if it wasn't refridgerated. The staff allowed me to put my items in their kitchen, no hassle, no fuss. Check-in and out was simple, and overall it was a great experience. I'm going back to Sydney again real soon, and I've been keeping an eye out for another deal. Unfortunately nothing has popped up. But then again, it just made me feel that what I had last time was truly a special experience. So forget the naysayers, this is a great hotel. And besides, aren't you in Sydney to sightsee? So who cares if the room is small? Right?

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 4 nights for a conference, one of these with my partner”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: Our night together was ... SNUG ... in very small room and bathroom. We loved the ambiance of the place ~ the foyer, gorgeous level 2 breakfast room, the furniture in the hotel room (not that we would have it in our home). Everything was clean and certainly compact. However, the room was quite oppresive. We/I had a choice of opening the opaque window for fresh air and suffering the incredible noise, or enduring the noisy and erratic aircon unit. POSITIVES: * shower was great; * bathroom pristine, though tiny * while the room door was v v v difficult to open initially, it was quickly repaired once I complained; * lovely blonde lady at breakfast in the STUNNING dining room. * they happily stored our bags on our last day * BRILLIANT location ~ central to everything * great/low prices for drinks and dinner on second floor NEGATIVES; * very small room * 2nd floor lounge for dinner had very limited choice and kitchen closed at 8,30pm. Blonde older woman server/manager? made us feel like an inconvenience * said lounge and room service unavailable on Sunday night ~ had to venture out to gain sustenance * major (taped) crack in window

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jo R
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night for as we were attending a show at the State Theatre - great location, friendly helpful staff, room clean - no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a very expensive city.”
Reviews.Author: Bah881
Reviews.Content: Before making a reservation at that hotel, I was considering several other options, but I chose this hotel for its location and good quality. I paid 140 $ per night for a twin room with taxes included but no breakfast. Overall, I am quite satisfied with this hotel. The room was a bit small, but cosy. The reception desk was helpful in all matters, and they booked a shuttle to the Sydney airport for us . There is no free wi-fi, so you have to buy it for 10 $ a day. Concerning location, It took around 20 minutes of walk to get to the Esplanade and the Sydney Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Vintage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shel3
Reviews.Content: Small room ideal as a base for exploring Sydney. Staff were really helpful. The hotel was a classic vintage style- loved it! As we were travelling up through Australia it was great as we had full use of the washing machine and dyrer with soap powder provided! Very cheap as we booked through expedia before we left.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never go back”
Reviews.Author: senorita08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotel rooms in Sydney and around the world, and this room was awful. It was a tiny room - with only a single bed. I could not dry myself in the bathroom without hitting my elbows. There was no air conditioning, and the windows didn't open, so that even in the middle of winter it was so hot and stuffy in the room it was unbearable. On a positive note, the room was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The ballroom where dinner and breakfast are served is spectacular, and the foyer is beautiful. But I will never stay there again, and will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Masonic building, once the tallest in Sydney, with charm and character.”
Reviews.Author: Ineedmrhols
Reviews.Content: Staying for business and booked by others. First room very 'character' but worn and those old-school opaque windows, high up. Also a bit too recently painted, but with plenty of reading lights and was perfectly adequate. Except for the wifi. Spoke to reception and the most charming conceirge, Louis, did all he could to no avail, including giving me a new password. He then called back 5 mins later and when I told him no luck, he swapped me to an excellent room, with a bath and windows that opened as the room I had was a bit tucked away and wasn't receiving the wifi signal. No fuss, and extremely polite. I was also able to check in at 8.30am! Unheard of! And was great not to have to take bag to meetings. I was also able to extend my stay one night and pay personally so I can have Friday night here. I think the building itself has a lot of character and charm and is something other than a bland typical hotel room. $10 a day for high speed wifi is rEasonable considering that most of the cliental are similar vintage to the building! There was a posse of melbourinian bridge players dressed to the nines in the foyer when I came down!

Reviews.Title: “I Thought they had shown me a cupboard it was so small.”
Reviews.Author: Pauline S
Reviews.Content: After seeing pictures of this Heritage listed Hotel we decided to book it for our first visit to Sydney. On arrival,There was no one to show us to the room, when we opened the door, it was soooo small. We even measured it to compare it to the cabin on the ship we were going to board later in the week, the cabin won hands down the room was just over 11 sq metres. the ships cabin was 17 sq metres. It was late in the day when we arrived and the curtains were drawn, when we tried to look out the window we unable to as it was locked and it had obscure wired glass, The bed in the room was a double (who has double beds),there was a cupboard for hanging clothes but no drawers or shelves, we were unable to empty our cases and they did not fit under the bed so all my lovely clothes were packed in a suitcase for nearly a week., I slept on the side of the bed closest to the door, in fact less than 3 feet from the door, it was draughty, noisy and light from the corridor shone through the large gap around the door all night. We asked to be moved, however the Hotel was fully booked and there were no spare rooms, We spoke to other residents who had much worse rooms than us, one side of the hotel was a huge building site for the new ANZ bank, and that was really noisy, one couple on that side had a window that was rusted open and were told it could not be closed,unfortunately they had prepaid and could not afford to move.It was a very cold wet week and the heating did not work. We were cold and I could understand how cold this other couple were. There was an really old TV which did not work properly, when we asked if it could be replaced, we were told maintainance did not work in the evening, and no one ever followed this up, The shower and toilet were clean but old and very small, My worst complaint was the old old bed linen, the blankets were really old hard and scratchy woollen ones and the pillows old lumpy things. The only acceptable thing about this Hotel is the location which was excellent and within walking distance of the shuttle bus and The Sky Tower, There is a great pie shop next door.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JHG22
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is central to all the main attractions of Sydney.The hotel itself is ok but book knowing that you get what you pay for. The reception staff didn't go out of their way to be helpful and when there was a problem with one of the washing machines on our floor, they didn't help at all, saying that there were not enough staff to allow them to send someone up to help so we were left to fathom it out for ourselves. The bedroom was an ok size but the bathroom was tin. The bedroom window was also in bad need of repair and would not close properly meaning that when the workmen started work on the road below in the early hours of Saturday morning, there was little we could do. We only stayed a couple of nights so we weren't too put out but if you are planning on staying in Sydney for longer, I suggest book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ObesaCantavit
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying here, given that I'd booked *before* reading the reviews. I was particularly concerned because my partner was in Sydney for work and really needed a decent night's sleep. Fortunately, I had gone with a 'queen deluxe' room. While the room was still on the small side, it was adequate to our needs. Let's face it, my partner was there to work, me to get out amongst it, so we only needed a reasonably comfortable place to sleep and clean up. In addition to the PERFECT location, on the plus side, the room and bathroom were perfectly clean and kept that way by housekeeping. Our room was on the 10th floor, and being at the front of the hotel, had a view through the window through a gap between buildings to Hyde Park. The bathroom actually had a tub in it, which got brownie points from me after a hard day sightseeing and shopping! For the most part, the staff were also excellent; helpful and polite. Of course, yes, there is a downside to the place. Yes, there is a building site next door. They were doing a major concrete pour the week we were there (always helps to chat with the workers to know what's going on), so the noise levels were moderate, but didn't bother us too badly. No way in heaven (or the other place) would I eat there (I'm a chef, I know what to look for 'nuff said), but this is the middle of the Sydney CBD, so no hassle really. Bar (in terms of offering and service) is straight out of some 70s thang. Again, 'nuff said, and again, given location, not an issue. All up. Would I stay there again? Yes, if I got to pick my room, and I had some idea of where the building works were up to.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: StevieSl
Reviews.Content: A major sky scraper is being built next door. Loud. Construction noise from 6:30 Am until well into evening, weekends aswell. Asked to move but made little difference as windows single glazed, even on 11th floor. Middle aged reception lady helpful, Chinese guy rude. Think hotel should be closed until building next door complete or offered at substantial discount. Rooms bit dated, double beds very small. Location good

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly.”
Reviews.Author: daysandusky
Reviews.Content: The good: The Castlereagh has the best rates you'll find in Sydney's central business district. The location is excellent -- walkable to most tourist destinations. The lobby is very nice, and the neighborhood is safe. The staff is friendly and helpful, and housekeeping does a good job. The bad: Management is miserly. Broken windows were not repaired, furniture and fixtures were shabby, broken brass railing in elevator was held in place with duct tape. Hotel breakfast was overpriced and minimal, bartender obviously wished she were somewhere else. Noisy throughout building from construction next door (though there's not much management can do about that.) The ugly: Guest rooms were not just small, they were extraordinarily gloomy. Walls were painted a dark mustard, adding to the claustrophobia. Lamps were glued (!) to end tables, making it difficult to read in bed. There was only one small window; dirty, yellow frosted glass reinforced with chicken wire. The tiny, ghastly-lit bathroom had a sink the size of a drinking fountain. The exhaust fan sounded like a jet engine, and every faucet had loose handles. After two nights staying in one of these depressing cells, I asked at the front desk if I could have a room with a little more light. They cheerfully re-assigned me to another single room with a double bed on an upper floor. Before packing up and moving my stuff, I went up to check out the new room. It was exactly the same as the old one. However, for $10 more per night, I took a "Queen" room at the front of the hotel. Much more space, with a large clear-glass window (though cracked and repaired with packing tape) that let in ample light. A little more noise from the street, but definitely worth the move. In short: The Castlereagh is cheap, but... well, cheap. It's too bad that such a noble old building is being run into the ground. With a little vision and a few more bucks, management could brighten up the rooms, make proper repairs, and turn this place into something fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Old World Charm, Fantastic location, Spotless and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MaryS1960
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned after reading other people's reviews on this motel but thankfully our experience was nothing but fantastic. Our room was a Queen Size room, it was very clean and I DID NOT see one cockroach!! One other reviewer commented that all keys seemed to fit other rooms, I did not find this to be the case, A key is needed in the lift to get to the floor that your room is located on but I could not get my key to work in another door (family in another room). The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Location was fantastic. Noise is to be expected as located in the CBD, our biggest noise concern was probably the inconsiderate guests returning to their rooms, but you can't blame the hotel for other people's rudeness. We will stay here again and are only too happy to recommend this motel to anyone that needs reasonably priced accommodation that has a wonderful feel to it and is after a fantastic location. Also worth mentioning is the well priced drink prices in the bar on both the ground floor and 2nd floor lounge area. Great stay, great place and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value But”
Reviews.Author: BucketList55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. It was located in the city and withing walking distance to major attractions such as the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Darling Harbour. The rooms are comfortable but old fashioned with not much natural light. The bathroom was small but the shower was nice and hot. For what we wanted (a bed and shower) it was good value although room service didnt replace the English Breakfast tea everyday and glasses that were brought up from the Lounge werent taken away. The drinks in the Lounge were also very cheap but unfortunately the Lounge closed at 8.30pm. There is plenty of food choices around the area as well. The one thing that did concern us which we realised during our stay because friends were also staying in the same hotel, was that the key you use to go in the lift also opens your door as well as others. There is also building work next door and you are woken in the mornings with the noise

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location.”
Reviews.Author: barry1842
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about visiting this hotel after reading some of the negative reviews. However we were delighted when we arrived to find the location, value and room exceeded our expectations. Very clean hotel, service and staff were very good. Location to all Sydney can offer was excellent with the Centrepoint and shops and other locations within an easy walk to the hotel. Darling Harbour was an easy 20 minute walk also Circular Quay. Thankyou to the hotel staff for making our welcome and stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ela019
Reviews.Content: Small and a bit grim room with paper thin walls you could hear everything. The air conditioning is just outside your window and and it is very noisy at night. It is in the centre of Sydney and you can walk to Opera House and Darling Harbour. We wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pwhite63
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel gave us very good value for what we paid compared to similar hotels in Sydney. Louis the front desk attendant was very helpful and the service was great. The rooms were small but the location was pretty good within a 15 minute walk to the harbor, Opera, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: hmj1986
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about here. The location is great - easy to walk to all the major attractions. We got an amazing deal on this hotel so the value really cannot be beat. I thought for sure I'd be spending at least twice what I did to get a centrally located, non-hostel place to stay. We stayed here for a few nights when we first arrived to Sydney, and a few more before flying home. Check in and out both times was a breeze. The staff was helpful with any questions we had. Both rooms were on the small side (not unbearably so) but that's to be expected. Most importantly, the bed and linens were clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was also very clean. I'd definitely stay here again on my next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Construction, Old-fashioned, Small and dark roomsâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: LaoBlue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel. This was too long! This hotel has a very old-fashioned feeling. The room was extremely small with one small window and tiny bathroom! The rooms are extremely small and the bed takes up over 80% of the room, and unfortunately there is construction going right next door. The noise from the crane and other machinery is a bit overbearing throughout the day, and begins around 7:30am every morning, except Sunday! This is an old hotel with a very old and slow elevator. However, the lobby and lounge is charming â€“ but I did not stay in this hotel for those! If you only plan to stay in the hotel room for sleeping (until the noise begins), then you would be ok, but I would not pay more than 100 dollars a night for this old-fashioned place. Look for a good deal, and book a night or two first. I would not return just because the room was too small lacking good ventilation and the construction noise! Wireless internet is available for 10 dollars/day. If under 100 usd/day, maybe ok if you like small dark rooms with lots of noise around you!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and get complimentary cockroach with your room :)”
Reviews.Author: rachandmat
Reviews.Content: Three of us booked this hotel because of its location in Sydney. Rooms were tiny but clean (or so we thought) The first time we went to the bathroom we noticed a cockroach walking around on the toilet seat! With disgust I called up reception and asked to be moved, we were told this would not happen but they would give us complimentary drinks and someone would come up and clean the bathroom. (whip-eee) The man was very nice that came up to clean the bathroom, after 30 mins or so he was done. I then reminded him that the cockroach was on the actual seat (which he had not cleaned in the 30 mins). Good - Location, nice cockroach cleaner man, reception lady was helpful with directions around Sydney Bad - Cockroach, price (paid way too much for this place), Squeaking wheels at 7am from the cleaners, view of a concrete wall Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK depending on the price”
Reviews.Author: Postcode
Reviews.Content: Location good. One block from Pitt St mall. Near everything with a quick walk or train ride. Rooms look like something from a bygone era which is a good thing. Beautiful furniture but not always usable due to the small rooms. Tried the TV once and a small selection of channels available. No need for an alarm clock as even as I was on the opposite side of the building activity I was woken at 7 am. Unfortunately every time I entered the room or turned on the bathroom light there were several small cockroaches running for cover. The room was cleaned well but there was a large amount of mould on the shower grouting. Desk staff ranged from extremely polite and helpful remembering my room when asking for my key, to one who needed to be personally addressed to leave his seat. Their website says 4*. An exaggeration. If you can get this hotel at a reasonable price it's OK. Avoid the high internet charges by buying a USB modem plus internet deal from any electronics dealer.

Reviews.Title: “Budget boutique”
Reviews.Author: emilyk57
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Australia Day 2011. The hotel was very centrally located, maybe a 5 minute walk to the main shopping district around Pitt Street, to the lovely Hyde Park and St James station where you can catch a train to Sydney airport in about 15-20 minutes. It is also within walking distance (more like 20 minutes) of a lot of major attractions such as Cockle Bay where you can go to the aquarium/IMAX/maritime museum and also Darling Harbour and the Sydney Opera House. The staff were helpful and polite. The hotel itself feels quite secure. Our room was quite small and the double bed was not full size. I am 5 foot 10 and my feet basically hung off the end of it. Sleeping here wasn't the most comfortable thing in the world. The pillows were rock hard. As we stayed in summer, the air conditioning was on pretty much all the time and was very refreshing to walk into after a long walk in 34 degree heat. The bathroom was small, as well, but big enough to do all the necessities, although you really had to come out into the main room to dry yourself after a shower and get dressed. So basically, only come to this hotel if you're with someone you're prepared to be quite intimate with!! Oh, and the walls are very thin, too. You can hear people coughing in the next room and the air conditioning is quite loud. We were unfortunate enough to stay while there was some serious construction going on next door (late January 2011). We had a lovely view of the construction site. However, this meant early in the morning - about 7-8AM - the drills and machinery would start up, making it impossible to sleep. When we were there the construction had only just begun, so unless you're an early riser anyway or just love the sound of drills I would avoid this hotel for a while. Wifi was available for $10 for 24 hours which is quite expensive but the process was easy, convenient and the Wifi was actually pretty quick. If you want free Wifi though there is a McDonalds around the corner from the hotel. There is a 'restaurant' offering dinner in the hotel but unless you like toasted cheese sandwiches I wouldn't bother. Just venture out to one of the many nice restaurants within walking distance. Or if you're on a budget, there's a Subway literally across the road and many food courts nearby. I would recommend this hotel for short stays, really. Anyone on a budget will appreciate the centrality of this hotel, but light sleepers will certainly not appreciate the frequent noise.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, good location”
Reviews.Author: verybadbaby
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Central to everything. Hotel is badly in need of updating and there is a building being constructed next door, with noise starting at 7am every day. Some issues with service levels with some staff. Stay away from the Wi-Fi - very slow and $10 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the room was so tiny.”
Reviews.Author: JoyPath
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Castlereagh, but the room was tiny with no view - which made the room feel even smaller. The staff was very friendly, the location was great, and the price was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint old lady of a bygone era.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs_Two
Reviews.Content: Lovely quaint hotel, original style lovingly maintained. We felt we got good value for our room rate. While our room was small, it was fine for just a couple of days. It was well decked out with a round table and two dining chairs. Weâ€™ve stayed in 4 star hotels where only having one chair on offer, meant someone had to sit on the bed to watch TV or eat. Well stocked mini bar with sensible pricing. A choice of teas and coffees were gratis. While the room was small, it had generous storage, so the room wasnâ€™t minimised at all. The Castlereagh is in a great location. Beautiful Hyde Park is just around the corner and trains and buses only a stoneâ€™s throw away. A few minutesâ€™ walk has you right in the hub of shopping, bars, eateries, and not too far from Darling Harbour and Chinatown. The staff couldnâ€™t be more helpful. Friendly, knowledgeable and make you feel welcome. Everyone who has submitted a review agrees that Sophie is a great asset to the hotel, and we heartily reinforce that opinion. Weâ€™re happy to recommend the Castlereagh and wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! Just a wonderful place to stay, its a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet55
Reviews.Content: Cannot speak highly enough of all of the staff! Sophie was curteous and genuinely pleasant as was the gentleman who greeted us Saturday afternoon (I unfortunately forgot to take his name) We had the pleasure of staying overnight at The Castlereagh late last year and did not hesitate to return for our sons birthday this year and will return again when visiting your wonderful city next time! Re: The amenaties:we did not require all of what the questions asked! We flew in just for the overnight stay and did not even have the time for breakfast/lunch/dinner, that was taken care of by family elsewhere, however we did pop into the restaurant area for a look and was very impressed! Will try everyting next time when we may be able to stay for a few days? A most impressive experience, with wonderful staff, very, very clean rooms and so close to everything! We have stayed at many different hotels/motels here and overseas and this IS the cleanest one yet! It suited us perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and central location”
Reviews.Author: ochlophobic
Reviews.Content: The room was booked as a convenient central Sydney location on a weekend trip. The room was rather small but was well maintained with period furniture and a comfortable bed. Reception was friendly and efficient. We ate out so did not sample the restaurant for dinner or breakfast. Wi-fi connection was listed as $10 per day. The hotel represented a comfortable central location at a reasonable price. There are significant construction works in the vicinity of the hotel which might impact on amenity during the week but as we stayed there at the weekend it was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: linky1980
Reviews.Content: When staying in Sydney location is very important and the Castlereagh hotel is perfect so long as you are comfortable walking 15 to 20 minutes as this could get you to both Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. The room was a little on the small side but we hardly used it as staying in Sydney is not about hotel rooms! We utilised the lounge on a couple of occasions and were impressed by the service and value for money. The provision of free laundry services was a unexpected bonus. Despite the construction next door, the only disruption was the taxi could not stop directly outside the hotel. Our sleep was not disrupted. Our greatest disappointment with the room was the lack of opening window/view but the price for a central hotel justified this small inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to many Sydney sights”
Reviews.Author: tdawg40sw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Castlereagh Hotel for 3 nights in mid Novemeber. The hotel rooms were indeed small, as other reviews have said, but they were very well kept. Unfortunately, our room had no view. In fact, our windows were frosted so you couldnâ€™t even see outside. The hotel staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. The location of the hotel was good. It took us about 20 mins to walk to Circular Quay, The Rocks, or Darling Harbour. We didnâ€™t plan on spending much time in the hotel and wanted somewhere within walking distance of the main sights. We got exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but can be very noisy”
Reviews.Author: aussieted_3000
Reviews.Content: First - the good news. Nice hotel for Sydney at a good price. Staff are helpful and the rooms are clean. We didn't have an issue with the size of the rooms - they are in fact quite good for Sydney inner city hotels. Easy walk to Darling Harbour, Opera House etc. Now the bad news. There is a construction site next door - a whole new building is being erected. The builders have a site permit for 7am to 7pm and they use every minute of it. This is tolerable, until one night we got no sleep because they had an extra permit to work 8pm to 6am. Permit was for the next night as well. WIndows are not glazed, there is no protection from the noise. Managed to get moved to the other side of the hotel which was ok, but if you are on the contsruction side you will get noise.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, boutique hotel in heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: magic006
Reviews.Content: We had a memorable stay at this elegant hotel in October 2010 & found it to be incredibly central to the best shopping spots & restaurants of downtown Sydney. The Cello in-house restaurant was superb, and room service was also first class, & reasonably priced. Our room was on the small side but perfectly adequate for our purposes, & was clean & well appointed. We believe the Hotel gave very good value for money & that the staff were professional & helpful. I would have preferred free wi fi but internet connection was an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay There Again In A Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: KimmyBee71
Reviews.Content: I travel for business a *lot* and I can say without doubt that the reception staff at this hotel is by far the best that I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Friendly, courteous, and almost unbelievably helpful (especially Sophie, who is by far the best tour guide in the city of Sydney), they were all assets to their employer and I'd hire them away in a minute if I could. The hotel is centrally located, with a Starbuck's less than a block away for you coffee addicts (like me), a great Chinese place (Palace Chinese. Yum.) just four doors down the street, a 2 minute walk from Hyde Park, a 5 minute walk from St. Mary's Cathedral, 15 minutes from the Art Gallery of NSW, and about 30 minutes from Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and The Rocks (you could probably walk it in 20 minutes if you didn't stop to window shop). Very convenient to the great shopping to be found on Pitt Street (big name boutiques galore). Walking off the street and into the lobby is like walking back in time and into the glamor of the 1930's or 40's. Shining floors, huge vases of flowers, dark gleaming woodwork everywhere you look. The elevators are a bit slow, but I liked the security offered by the key system (the elevator will not work unless you insert your room key to indicate which floor you want). Cello's Restaurant was closed while we were there, but there was a second floor Lounge that offered good drinks and tolerable food. When I go back, Ill skip the Lounge and walk down to Palace Chinese. I stayed in room 702, which was very clean, well decorated with vintage furniture and had a small but well-appointed bathroom with a large walk-in shower. My friends stayed in room 603, which was roughly double the size of my room and had a bathroom large enough to hold a small table and chairs. Next time I will ask for their room. As a woman traveling essentially alone (my friends were on another floor) I felt safe, secure and well looked after at all times in this hotel and will stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “old building, small pretty rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: chrgra
Reviews.Content: I had room 908 with no view, which suited me fine as i don't want street noise. The building's age shows in the noisy plumbing or the window that won't close. The furniture was nice, the bedding good, the bathroom renovated and clean, the room smallish, the staff friendly and helpful, the location perfect for my needs, room at the right temparature, so overall i was happy. Unsure sound proofing would be any good if hotel was full though.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is very old and is overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Athex
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately ended up staying here because there was a convention in town and pretty much every other place that was reasonably priced was taken. The biggest issues in the hotel were the lack of AC, even though it was winter the heat was turned up so high that it was hard to manage the room so it was comfortable and the slow slow elevators. i felt that if the price for the room was under $100 it would have been fair, but since we paid over that the room was a poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm, a little small”
Reviews.Author: Dazel_London
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but comfortable enough. The bed seemed small also for two people. The bathroom did not fit the style of the room as it was weird sliding door type. We had not view from the window as it was frosted. The A/C was not working either so the room was a little hot. The staff were helpful and the location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and appealing hotel with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: HLT-Heyfield
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel offering all that I required. The decor is appealing to those who appreciate the character of older properties. The bathroom was large and functional but requiring minor maintenance. Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MaryG_from_Toronto
Reviews.Content: The room isn't the biggest, but this gorgeous hotel makes up for it. Antiques adorn each room, and the hallway. It's nice to look at but if you have more than two suitcases, you may find you can't leave them lying open on the floor because you'll trip over them. Rooms are clean. The bathroom is a tight squeeze but enough room. The front desk staff is helpful, their directions to the tourist attractions were accurate. I cut myself and needed bandages, and they gave me as many as I needed. It was one block away from St. James subway station, Hyde Park, and a major department store. It is a pretty far walk away from Circular Quay, but only big, expensive chains like the Shangri-La and the Four Seasons are closer, so it was a good downtown location for the price. It is on one of the more quiet streets, so you'll get a good nights street. The busy street is about 4 main intersections over. The website says you can ask them for a free room upgrade if there is space available, but we forgot to ask and no one offered us an upgrade. We didn't eat at the restaurant so can't review.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surpise!”
Reviews.Author: FORD48
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Castlereaugh was my first at a boutique hotel. After my trip to Australia the Castlereaugh is at the top of my list for pleasant places to stay. The staff were all plesant and very helpful. With a security key -- I felt very safe. The price was very conservative. Yes my room was small -- but comforttable -- I had a small table to work on -- a clean bath with shower and a closet large enough to put my clothes and suitcase --- I did not miss the large empty space rooms found in America. After all I was not in Sydney to stay in my hotel room! ... except to sleep. The bed was comfortable --- They do have larger rooms and are able to accommodate families. If I have a critique it is the limited food availablity - the world class restaurant is only open on weekends for dinner; the lounge has a very limited menu --- but the choices I tasted (meat pie and lasagna) were superb!

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Elegance in a great location and at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: 1FreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two night stay at this hotel and were very impressed. After reading some of the reviews prior to our trip we had some doubts on whether or not to stay there but after returning we would definitely stay there again. Centrally located in Sydney city and within walking distance of everything, this hotel provides old style elegance with lots of charm. Entering into the air conditioned foyer you are immediately impressed by the decor which although more than sixty years old still retains life and beauty you would expect from a newer hotel, and the walls are lined with old pictures of Sydney providing a fascinating insight into the days-of-old. Our room on the sixth floor was to the rear of the hotel meaning that any street noise was dulled out and travelling with a baby, the travel cot provided still allowed for more space in the room. The furniture is dated but in excellent condition and you can be assured of a great night sleep on the bed. The bathroom is suitable with a very good shower head too. There is a lounge bar within the hotel which has beer and other drinks at a very reasonable price and the bar was very quiet while we were there. Staff are helpful too. While there is no parking onsite the hotel has an agreement with another hotel located close by to get better weekend rates or alternatively you can utilise (expensive) metre parking or otherwise park 15 mins away and walk to the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of every city location, is close to bus stops, Town Hall railway station, cafes, restaurants and taxis are everywhere. Security is excellent with keyed access to each floor. We paid $154 AUD per night and feel we got good value for money for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Elegance.”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Wanderer1949
Reviews.Content: My father (86yrs) and I (61 yrs) stayed at The Castlereagh on the 6th March 2010. I booked the hotel according to two criteria - price and location. As I have stayed at less expensive hotels before, I didn't expect much. I was wrong. As we walked into the reception area, we were both surprised by the quality of the decor - rich, warm and inviting. The bar beyond was equally as appealing. One previous reviewer had stated that the furniture was 'old'. Yes, it was, but old as in antique quality, not tatty and worn out. The reception staff were very friendly and dealt quickly with our check-in. One thing that really pleased me was the security key needed to operate the lift to our floor. Often, less expensive hotels and backpackers have no security, with anyone free to walk in. Our twin room was larger than most hotel rooms, even five star hotels' lead in priced rooms are often smaller. The bathroom had been renovated, with a good large shower, basin and toilet. The beds were very comfortable, the linen impeccable. If you want a view, don't stay here - pay triple and stay at the Quay. The frosted glass windows let in adequate light, and they also opened. Being a narrow hotel running back from the road, the rooms were free of street noise. Even though the hotel appeared full, we had no noise problems apart from the noisy shower next door. The location was great - close to the monorail, railway and bus stop, which I needed for Dad to be able to get around with comfort. If you are a shopaholic, Sydney's main department stores are only 50 metres away, and the beautiful QV Building just round the corner. Usually I stay at the Y on Hyde Park - in future I will be staying at this gracious old building. If you are a fan of chrome and glass, this might not appeal to you. But if you you like old fashioned hospitality and comfort, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Fine!”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_Boy
Reviews.Content: Let me ask you this... When you go to a foreign country, do you want to sit in a hotel, or do you want to tour the sites and eat their fine food, and then go out drinking? I never turned the TV on once in my 9 days. The beds were made, the towels were fresh, the laundry rooms on 7 and 11 worked, were free and had soap. What more do you want? It's right in the heart of Sydney. A block away from Hyde Park, two steps away from one of the only remaining Starbucks in town. Busses every 5 minutes to Bondai, 2 different Subway routes within a 3 minute walk, shopping, grocery store.... are you nuts? For THIS price? Yes, the rooms need updating, but the wireless works, the bathrooms HAVE been updated and are spacious and nice, there are two bars and you can walk everywhere. I mean EVERYWHERE. Save the $$$ on the Sheraton because its fricken EXPENSIVE in Oz. Twenty bucks every time you grab a cab. $3.50 for a coke. A buck for a banana and even $7.00 round trip via subway/tube/train (whatever you want to call it). At least the beer was cheap, and its twice the alcohol :) ONLY drawback was no room service. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ozziegiraffe
Reviews.Content: When I was booked to stay at the Castlereagh, I looked up reviews on Trip Advisor, and was expecting the worst. I was part of a large group attending a conference there, and was booked to share a room with someone I hadn't met. In fact I was mostly pleasantly surprised. Generally, the room and bathroom were clean and nicely decorated, but there were a few drawbacks - the step up to the bathroom (hard when you are trying not to disturb a sleeping roommate), and the lack of a real window (a very narrow one with opaque glass, that couldn't be opened). Also, while the room was a good double, the second bed was not really adequate for a twin, being one of those quasi-couches that have bolsters which must be removed to use it as a bed. A friend had booked a single, which had only a single bed. However, it had a better window, and was very pleasant. In fact the staff apologised for its smallness. It appears some of the front rooms had better windows. We had none of the noise problems others complained of. Meals, bars etc were lovely, as were all the staff, including the workmen who were renovating some floors, and even the firemen who answered an alarm while we were there. We even received a free drink voucher each day. Most of all, the location was very convenient, especially for anyone needing to be in the city centre. There is a taxi rank just around the corner in Park Street, and a camera shop and post office next door. Apart from this, the lifts were slow, and our conference had to use rooms on several floors. We regularly made use of the seats thoughtfully provided near the lifts. The other minor problem was the lack of a ramp as an alternate to the stairs from the street. It would not be very easy for a wheelchair or stroller to access.

Reviews.Title: “Very odd, like sleeping in a coffin”
Reviews.Author: chickndude
Reviews.Content: OK. It's my fault we stayed at this hotel, I was looking for something cheap and different and didn't realise what I was getting us into. I've stayed in small hotel rooms before ( Paris ) but this takes the biscuit, it is sooooooooooo small and boxy and actually quite distressing to remain in. It is seriously odd and unless you are a Mason or will sleep on the street otherwise I would not reccomend you stay here. Please if you want to stay in Sydney just pay for somewhere good. This was a cheap last minute fix for somewhere to stay and I will never live down having booked it. Don't book it either unless you want to freak yourself out and have the people who stay with you be mad at you for a while. 'Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan!”
Reviews.Author: KelvinHeights
Reviews.Content: Sydney was the second port of call on our world tour and we wanted a hotel we could relate to and relax in. This was not it! The room we were assigned was so small that we had to sit on the bed and there were absolutely no drawers for clothes. We asked for an upgrade and were given a family room that had slightly more room and an additional single bed. The shower room was in a cupboard with a sliding door and a disconcerting step up. The room decor was 50s/early 60s and definitely not of 'boutique' standard. We had expected something unusual and stylish. The Masonic Club of New South Wales - which is based in the hotel - certainly surprised us as there was no mention of this in Expedia's description. The lobby and reception areas did have some style but that stopped once you stepped into your room. Security was good.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: AudreyChin
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I asked for a quiet room when I booked in but the male receptionist told me that every room is the same. This appears to be not true. To begin with, I was put on the 9th room next to the elevator. Obviously, this being a very old hotel, the walls are very thin, hence I could hear the noises made by the elevator. In addition, it was "freezing cold" - there was no way in which the air condition system can be adjusted. I had to wear 3 layers of clothing to bed but despite that, I was shivering. So, I spend the first sleepless night at this hotel. The next morning, I asked for a change of room and mentioned that I am also cold. They do not seem to be very interested in my problem or suggest how I can get around the cold. I have to leave my luggage in their store room and wait till lunch time for a new room to be allocated. Later in the day, I was allocated a room on the 10th room away from the elevator end. I could hear loud "jarring" noises when I went into the room. I thought it was some drilling noise due to renovations and that would stop at night. However, the noise seemed to carry on. I found this out the next morning when the receptionist told me that my room was very near the air-conditioning system. On that day, I managed to secure a heater after I met their cleaner who advised me to get one from the reception as the air condition system cannot be fixed. So, I spent the second night again sleepless due to the noise and had to constantly turned on and off the small broken heater which also made a very loud noise due to the fan. The next morning, I asked for a change of room. Finally, I got a room that has very little noise and not so cold. I totally agreed with the other reviewers that the rooms are dingy, small and not up to standards. The first room was not very clean, as there were hair in the basin and the bathroom wall. What made it worse was that the staff did not tried to solve my problems I was given very noisy rooms. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: J0erg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the castlereagh for new year in sydney, the location is ok, the staff friendly, and very close to everything in central Sydney, the hotel is clean, but thats it. The room had only frosted glass windows almost at ceiling height to get some daylight in and a terrible central aircondition system that must date back to the 1960s, with an air-outlet blowing directly onto the bed, accompanied by a dreadful noise, and no way to turn it off or control it somehow. (Eventually we stuffed towels into the outlet to stand it somehow). Definitely not worth the price we paid (280 $) even considering that it was the NYE-rate.

Reviews.Title: “cozy & sweet”
Reviews.Author: Aussie89
Reviews.Content: My family were in from America and we booked two rooms for 10 days. The hotel is just two blocks from David Jones & 15 minutes walk to Circular Quay. It's a really pretty hotel with good service etc. The only things I would complain about are the tiny rooms. I guess you can expect that in Sydney, but it would be easy to feel clausterphobic. Convenient parking is non-existent, even a drop off & pick up point for guests is not available. We were pushing a pram and had to carry it up the front steps of the hotel... There was no warning on the website & if we had booked a wheelchair person into the hotel, I cannot see how they would enter.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladymont
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there last month for three nights and were very pleased with the accommodation. Lobby is charming and the bedroom was nicely decorated with pretty lamps, bedspread and carpet. The matresses were comfortable and the bathroom was sparkling clean. Continental breakfast was served in the lovely, period diningroom and hot breakfast was only $8.00 extra. There was no view, but who cares really as we were out and about most of the day. Staff also are pleasant and helpful. Of course we would stay there again. We do try to find hotels other than the big chains when traveling overseas and have no interest in spending hundreds of dollars for one night's accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, noisy and cold room”
Reviews.Author: emcampb
Reviews.Content: The reception area of this hotel is majestic, thats about as far as it goes. After waiting for what seemed like hours for the tiny old lift after we checked in, we made our way up to the tenth floor. I was excited and hoping for a view. Not to be. Our room was barely big enough for the (just) double bed that we were supplied with. Lucky I wasn't planning to swing any cats during our stay. Our frosted window looked out onto the side of another building and the room was dark and dingy. The bathroom was also very small. We had no control over the air vent that blew freezing air into our room all night, along with the shrieks and yells of what I presume to be other guests staying at the hotel. We shivered under the sheet and comforter we were supplied with as bedding and it was with bleary eyes we made our way out to the "ironing room" in the morning. Thats right, you don't get an iron in your room. Whilst the location is great - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ebears
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of "ole world charm" and its location is fantastic. If you want to be close to Myers, Queen victoria Building etc, this is the hotel. Rooms were OK and the bed was comfortable. Staff were helpful with queries. I liked the decor which is welcome after the modern day hotels where you pay for their decorations. I would stay at this hotel again when in Sydney due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: GoffWelchman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located right in the heart of Sydney's main attractions. Darling Harbour, the Bridge, the Opera House, the Botanical Gardens and Chinatown are all within a half - hour's walk, or a very short and inexpensive bus ride. The Sky Tower is within 3 minute's walk. The hotel is a reminder of former colonial times, and staff are welcoming and helpful. It is extremely good value for its location, the included continental breakfast is perfectly adequate, and the dinner quality is excellent, although with so many restaurants around the harbour, most guests eat out. We only had 3 criticisms. 1/. The windows are very old single - glazing, so you need to insist on a room away from extractor fans, if you sleep lightly. 2/. Breakfast is only served until 9.00 am, even at weekends. 3/. There are 2 bars. The ground floor lounge is very pleasant, but the upstairs one is more reminiscent of a cheap amusement arcade. Don't let these points put you off, though. We would certainly stay there again. We were especially fond of the main breakfast waitress, who was so friendly and helpful, even lending us her discount pass for the Zoo !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint old fashioned service”
Reviews.Author: melwollongong
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of March. Although our deluxe room was small, it was very classy and clean. Lovely soft sheets, gorgeous paintings and old worlde antique style furniture. It felt like staying in an old mansion, but we were right in the heart of Sydney. Our room included a complimentary drink in the bar which was divine, there are even a few poker machines. Light continental breakfast was included and the restaurant was divine. For an old hotel, it is extremely well maintained. I could not fault this place and will definitely stay again. The only disadvantage was that there is no on-site parking. You can park at the Picadilly carpark for about $14 overnight, our room rate was $155 which was an absolute bargain for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights over new year eve 2004. We had problems booking a hotel for obvious reasons over this period and were relieved to simply find some accomodation. We paid considerably less for the accomodation than we expected to at this time of year, and it represents excellent value for money, we got a lot more than we expected for what we paid. We were very pleasantly suprised when we arrived to efficient staff and an impressive lobby area, everything was clean and well kept. We had a queen room, that was well appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was quite small for the size of the room, but the shower was good and clean! Although breakfast was fairly basic, it was substantial and of good quality. The dining room was fantastic, probably made to look even better as it was very tastefully decorated for xmas. Overall, we had a fantastic time in Sydney and would recommend this hotel to anyone that enjoys good quality and value for money. We would have paid twice as much for the same standard of room and service in a 'branded' hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Castlereagh Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 169 Castlereagh Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
